info.title: Camina Chat API
info.description:
Multi-provider API for interacting with various AI models and tools.

## Features:
- Multi-provider support: OpenAI, Anthropic, Mistral, Cohere, X.AI, Perplexity, MLX, Gemini, and more
- Streaming support
- Chat and instruction completion
- Document processing with the OpenAI Responses API
- Image generation
- Web search capabilities
- Academic research tools
- Tool/function calling

## Available Providers

The API supports the following providers:
- `anthropic`: Anthropic Claude models
- `mistral`: Mistral AI models
- `ollama`: Local models running through Ollama
- `openai`: OpenAI GPT models
- `cohere`: Cohere Command models
- `xai`: X.AI (Grok) models
- `coze`: Coze platform bots
- `perplexity`: Perplexity AI models
- `gemini`: Google Gemini models
- `mlx`: Apple MLX models (local on Apple Silicon)

## CURL Examples

### Chat Example (Claude)
```bash
curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/chat/anthropic \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "model": "claude-3-sonnet-20240229",
    "prompt": "Hello, how are you today?",
    "max_tokens": 1024,
    "stream": false
  }'
```

### Alt Text Example (OpenAI)
```bash
curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/alt/openai \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -F "model=gpt-4o" \
  -F "prompt=Generate detailed alt text for this image suitable for visually impaired users" \
  -F "image=@/path/to/your/image.jpg"
```

### Tools Example (Mistral)
```bash
curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/mistral \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "model": "mistral-large-2",
    "prompt": "What is the weather in Seattle?",
    "stream": false,
    "max_tokens": 500,
    "temperature": 0.7,
    "tools": [{
      "name": "get_weather",
      "description": "Get the current weather in a given location",
      "parameters": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "location": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "The city and state, e.g. San Francisco, CA"
          },
          "unit": {
            "type": "string",
            "enum": ["celsius", "fahrenheit"]
          }
        },
        "required": ["location"]
      }
    }]
  }'
```

### Gemini Example
```bash
curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/chat/gemini \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gemini-2.0-flash",
    "prompt": "Write a short poem about AI",
    "max_tokens": 1024,
    "stream": true
  }'
```

get.description: Get information about the API, including available providers and endpoints

Check the health status of the API and its supported providers.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X GET https://api.assisted.space/v2/health \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key"
```

List all available models for a specific provider.
## Usage Examples
- `/v2/models/anthropic`: List all Anthropic Claude models - `/v2/models/openai`: List all OpenAI GPT models - `/v2/models/ollama`: List all available models in your Ollama instance - `/v2/models/mistral`: List all Mistral AI models - `/v2/models/cohere`: List all Cohere models - `/v2/models/xai`: List all X.AI models - `/v2/models/coze`: List Coze bots with their IDs - `/v2/models/perplexity`: List all Perplexity AI models - `/v2/models/gemini`: List all Google Gemini models - `/v2/models/mlx`: List all installed Apple MLX models
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X GET https://api.assisted.space/v2/models/anthropic \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key"
```

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The provider to get models from

post.description:
Send a message to an AI model and get a response.

## Usage Examples

- `/v2/chat/anthropic`: Chat with Anthropic Claude
- `/v2/chat/openai`: Chat with OpenAI GPT models
- `/v2/chat/ollama`: Chat with local Ollama models
- `/v2/chat/mistral`: Chat with Mistral AI models
- `/v2/chat/cohere`: Chat with Cohere Command models
- `/v2/chat/xai`: Chat with X.AI Grok models
- `/v2/chat/coze`: Chat with Coze platform bots
- `/v2/chat/perplexity`: Chat with Perplexity AI models
- `/v2/chat/mlx`: Chat with Apple MLX models
- `/v2/chat/lmstudio`: Chat with LM Studio models

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The provider to use for the chat request

example.content: I'm doing well, thank you for asking! I'm Claude, an AI assistant created by Anthropic. I'm here to help with a wide range of tasks through conversation. How can I assist you today?

post.description:
Clear the conversation history for a provider.

## Usage Examples

- `/v2/chat/anthropic/clear`: Clear conversation history for Anthropic Claude
- `/v2/chat/openai/clear`: Clear conversation history for OpenAI
- `/v2/chat/ollama/clear`: Clear conversation history for Ollama
- `/v2/chat/mistral/clear`: Clear conversation history for Mistral AI
- `/v2/chat/cohere/clear`: Clear conversation history for Cohere
- `/v2/chat/xai/clear`: Clear conversation history for X.AI (Grok)
- `/v2/chat/coze/clear`: Clear conversation history for Coze

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The provider to clear conversation history for

post.description:
Generate descriptive alt text for an image.
## Usage Examples
- `/v2/alt/anthropic`: Generate alt text using Anthropic Claude - `/v2/alt/openai`: Generate alt text using OpenAI GPT-4 Vision - `/v2/alt/ollama`: Generate alt text using Ollama with vision models - `/v2/alt/mistral`: Generate alt text using Mistral Pixtral - `/v2/alt/xai`: Generate alt text using X.AI Grok Vision - `/v2/alt/coze`: Generate alt text using Coze Alt Text Generator Bot (ID: 7462296933429346310)
## CURL Examples
### OpenAI Alt Text Generation ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/alt/openai \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -F "model=gpt-4o" \
  -F "prompt=Generate detailed alt text for this image suitable for visually impaired users" \
  -F "image=@/path/to/your/image.jpg"
```
### Anthropic Alt Text Generation ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/alt/anthropic \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -F "model=claude-3-opus-20240229" \
  -F "prompt=Describe this image in detail" \
  -F "image=@/path/to/your/image.jpg"
```

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The provider to use for alt text generation

image.description: The image file to generate alt text for

prompt.description: Custom prompt for alt text generation
prompt.default: Generate descriptive alt text for this image

model.description: The model ID to use

example.alt_text: A simple test image with a red square on the left side and a blue circle on the right side. Below these shapes is the text 'Test Image' in black.

post.summary: Process Documents with OpenAI Responses API
post.description:
Process documents (PDF, text files, etc.) using the OpenAI Responses API. This endpoint allows you to analyze documents and generate responses based on their content.
## Features - Support for multiple file formats (PDF, TXT, DOCX, etc.) - Web search capability for retrieving current information - File search integration for document question answering - Tool calling for enhanced functionality - Streaming mode for real-time responses
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/responses \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -F "model=gpt-4o" \
  -F "prompt=Please analyze this document and provide a detailed summary" \
  -F "file=@/path/to/your/document.pdf" \
  -F "stream=false"
```
## Streaming Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/responses \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -F "model=gpt-4o" \
  -F "prompt=Please analyze this document and provide a detailed summary" \
  -F "file=@/path/to/your/document.pdf" \
  -F "stream=true"
```

model.description: The OpenAI model to use (e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4o-2024-11-20)

prompt.description: Instruction for the AI model about how to process the document
prompt.example: Please analyze this document and provide a detailed summary

file.description: File(s) to process (PDF, TXT, DOCX, etc.)

tools.description: Tools to make available to the model

web_search.description: Whether to enable web search capability

file_search.description: Whether to enable file search for document Q&A

computer_use.description: Whether to enable computer use tools

debug_mode.description: Whether to enable debug mode for detailed processing info

tool_choice.description: How the model should choose to use tools

response_id.description: The ID of the response, used to retrieve the result

status.description: The status of the request (completed, processing, error)

content.description: The content of the response (if completed immediately)

model.description: The model used to process the document

provider.description: The provider used to process the document

schema.description: Server-sent events stream with response chunks

get.description:
Retrieve the result of a document processing request.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X GET https://api.assisted.space/v2/responses/resp_abc123def456 \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key"
```

parameters.name: response_id
parameters.description: The ID of the response to retrieve

status.description: The status of the request (completed, processing, error)

content.example: This document is a research paper on climate change that discusses...

model.description: The model used to process the document

provider.description: The provider used to process the document

post.description:
Generate images using OpenAI's DALL-E models via the Images API.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/images/generate \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "prompt": "A surreal painting of a floating island with waterfalls",
    "model": "dall-e-3",
    "n": 1,
    "size": "1024x1024",
    "quality": "standard",
    "style": "vivid"
  }'
```

prompt.description: A text description of the desired image(s)

model.description: The model to use for image generation

n.description: The number of images to generate (1-4 for DALL-E 3, 1-10 for DALL-E 2)

size.description: The size of the generated images

quality.description: The quality of the image (DALL-E 3 only)

style.description: The style of the generated image (DALL-E 3 only)

post.description:
Edit existing images using OpenAI's DALL-E models. Provide an image and a mask to specify which areas to edit along with a prompt describing the desired changes.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/images/edit \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -F "image=@/path/to/your/image.png" \
  -F "mask=@/path/to/your/mask.png" \
  -F "prompt=Add a cute cat sitting in the foreground" \
  -F "model=dall-e-2" \
  -F "n=1" \
  -F "size=1024x1024"
```

image.description: The image to edit (must be a valid PNG file with transparency)

mask.description: An optional mask image showing which areas to edit (must be a valid PNG file with transparency). If not provided, regions with transparency in the image will be used as the mask.

prompt.description: A text description of the desired changes

model.description: The model to use for image editing

n.description: The number of images to generate

size.description: The size of the generated images

post.summary: Create image variations with OpenAI DALL-E
post.description:
Create variations of an existing image using OpenAI's DALL-E models.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/images/variations \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -F "image=@/path/to/your/image.png" \
  -F "model=dall-e-2" \
  -F "n=3" \
  -F "size=1024x1024"
```

image.description: The image to use as the basis for variations (must be a valid PNG or JPEG file)

model.description: The model to use for image variations

n.description: The number of variations to generate

size.description: The size of the generated variations

post.description:
Generate images using various supported providers. This endpoint will redirect to the appropriate provider-specific endpoint based on the provider parameter.
## Supported Providers - OpenAI (DALL-E models) - Gemini (experimental image generation) - X.AI (Grok models)
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/generate \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "provider": "openai",
    "prompt": "A surreal painting of a floating island with waterfalls",
    "model": "dall-e-3",
    "n": 1,
    "size": "1024x1024",
    "quality": "standard",
    "style": "vivid"
  }'
```

provider.description: The provider to use for image generation

prompt.description: A text description of the desired image(s)

model.description: The model to use for image generation (provider-specific)

n.description: The number of images to generate (provider-specific limitations apply)

size.description: The size of the generated images (provider-specific options apply)

quality.description: The quality of the image (provider-specific options apply)

style.description: The style of the generated image (provider-specific options apply)

post.description:
Generate images using OpenAI's DALL-E models.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/generate/openai \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "prompt": "A surreal painting of a floating island with waterfalls",
    "model": "dall-e-3",
    "n": 1,
    "size": "1024x1024",
    "quality": "standard",
    "style": "vivid"
  }'
```

prompt.description: A text description of the desired image(s)

model.description: The model to use for image generation

n.description: The number of images to generate (1-4 for DALL-E 3, 1-10 for DALL-E 2)

size.description: The size of the generated images

quality.description: The quality of the image (DALL-E 3 only)

style.description: The style of the generated image (DALL-E 3 only)

post.description:
Generate images using Google's Gemini experimental image generation capability.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/generate/gemini \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "prompt": "A futuristic cityscape with flying cars and neon lights",
    "model": "gemini-2.0-flash-exp-image-generation",
    "n": 1,
    "size": "1024x1024"
  }'
```

prompt.description: A text description of the desired image(s)

model.description: The model to use for image generation

n.description: The number of images to generate

size.description: The size of the generated images (currently only 1024x1024 supported)

post.description:
Generate images using X.AI (Grok) image generation capabilities.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/generate/xai \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "prompt": "A cyberpunk city at night with neon lights and flying vehicles",
    "model": "grok-2-image",
    "n": 1,
    "size": "1024x1024",
    "response_format": "url",
    "api_key": "xai-api-key-here"
  }'
```

prompt.description: The text prompt to generate an image from
prompt.example: A cyberpunk city at night with neon lights and flying vehicles

model.description: The X.AI model to use for image generation

api_key.description: Optional X.AI API key to use for this request

post.description:
Generate a chat response using Google's Gemini models.
## Features - Support for text-based chat - Vision capabilities with image input - Real-time streaming responses - Context window up to 128k tokens (model dependent)
## CURL Example (Text) ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/chat/gemini \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gemini-2.0-flash",
    "prompt": "Explain quantum computing to me.",
    "max_tokens": 1024,
    "temperature": 0.7,
    "stream": true
  }'
```
## CURL Example (Vision) ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/chat/gemini \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -F "model=gemini-1.5-pro" \
  -F "prompt=What can you tell me about this image?" \
  -F "image=@/path/to/your/image.jpg" \
  -F "stream=false"
```

model.description: The Gemini model to use

prompt.example: Write a short poem about artificial intelligence

max_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

image_path.description: Path to an image file (server-side, admin only)

schema.description: Server-sent events stream with response chunks

model.description: The Gemini model to use

prompt.example: What is the weather in Paris?

max_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

tools.description: Tools available for the model to use

content.example: The weather in Paris is currently 18°C and partly cloudy.

tool_calls.description: Tools that were called by the model

arguments.description: The arguments passed to the tool

model.description: The model used to generate the response

provider.description: The provider used to generate the response

post.description:
Generate images using Google Gemini's image generation capability.
## Features - Text-to-image generation - Experimental feature - Available with gemini-2.0-flash-exp-image-generation model
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/images/gemini \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gemini-2.0-flash-exp-image-generation",
    "prompt": "A cute robot gardener tending to a futuristic garden on Mars, digital art style",
    "n": 1,
    "size": "1024x1024",
    "response_format": "url"
  }'
```

model.description: The Gemini model to use (must support image generation)

prompt.description: The text prompt to generate an image from
prompt.example: A cute robot gardener tending to a futuristic garden on Mars, digital art style

created.description: Timestamp of when the images were created

model.description: The model used to generate the images

get.description:
Retrieve an archived version of a webpage using various archive services like  the Wayback Machine, Archive.is, Memento Aggregator, or 12ft.io.
## Features - Multiple archive providers - Support for archived snapshots - Optional capture capability for Archive.is - Paywall bypassing with 12ft.io
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X GET "https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/archive?url=https://example.com&provider=wayback" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key"
```

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to find an archived version for

parameters.name: capture
parameters.description: Whether to capture a new snapshot (for archiveis only)

message.example: Successfully retrieved the most recent snapshot from the Wayback Machine

post.description:
Retrieve an archived version of a webpage using various archive services. This POST endpoint is functionally identical to the GET version but accepts  parameters in the request body.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/archive \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "url": "https://example.com",
    "provider": "wayback",
    "capture": false
  }'
```

url.description: The URL to find an archived version for

capture.description: Whether to capture a new snapshot (for archiveis only)

message.example: Successfully retrieved the most recent snapshot from the Wayback Machine

get.description:
Get the JSON schema for the archive tool. This is useful for integrating the archive tool with other AI models and tools.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X GET https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/archive/schema \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key"
```

description.example: Retrieve an archived version of a webpage from various archive services

post.description:
Execute the get_archived_webpage tool directly without going through the provider's tool calling mechanism. This endpoint is useful for direct API access or for providers that don't support tool calling.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/execute/get_archived_webpage \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "url": "https://example.com",
    "provider": "wayback"
  }'
```

url.description: The URL to find an archived version for

capture.description: Whether to capture a new snapshot (for archiveis only)

message.example: Successfully retrieved the most recent snapshot from the Wayback Machine

post.description:
Execute Python code in a restricted environment. This endpoint allows running Python code safely in a sandboxed environment with limited permissions and resource usage.
## Security Features - Restricted environment with limited imports - Sandboxed execution - Resource limits to prevent abuse - Temporary file cleanup after execution
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/execute/code \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "code": "import math\n\nfor i in range(5):\n    print(f\"Square root of {i} is {math.sqrt(i)}\")"
  }'
```

result.description: The output of the code execution
result.example:
Square root of 0 is 0.0
Square root of 1 is 1.0
Square root of 2 is 1.4142135623730951
Square root of 3 is 1.7320508075688772
Square root of 4 is 2.0

error.example: Error executing code: NameError: name 'undefined_function' is not defined

post.description:
Analyze text for sentiment, key entities, and offensive content. This endpoint uses Tisane API to provide comprehensive text analysis.
## Features - Sentiment analysis (positive, negative, neutral) - Entity extraction (people, places, organizations, etc.) - Offensive content detection - Multi-language support
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/analyze/text \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "text": "I really enjoyed visiting New York City last summer. The people were friendly and the food was amazing.",
    "language": "en"
  }'
```

text.example: I really enjoyed visiting New York City last summer. The people were friendly and the food was amazing.

api_key.description: The Tisane API key (optional, uses default if not provided)

result.example:
Text Analysis Results:

  Sentiment: positive
  Entities: New York City
  No offensive content detected.

text.example: I really enjoyed visiting New York City last summer. The people were friendly and the food was amazing.

language.description: The language code used for analysis

error.example: Error analyzing text: API request failed

text.example: I really enjoyed visiting New York City last summer. The people were friendly and the food was amazing.

data.description: The data to convert (as JSON object or string)

success.description: Whether the format conversion was successful

result.example:
name: John Doe
age: 30
address:
  street: 123 Main St
  city: Anytown
  zip: '12345'
hobbies:
- reading
- running
- coding

original_data.description: The original data that was converted

post.description:
Execute the analyze_text tool directly without going through the provider's tool calling mechanism. This endpoint is useful for direct API access or for providers that don't support tool calling.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/execute/analyze_text \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "text": "I really enjoyed visiting New York City last summer. The people were friendly and the food was amazing.",
    "language": "en"
  }'
```

text.example: I really enjoyed visiting New York City last summer. The people were friendly and the food was amazing.

data.description: The data to convert (as JSON object or string)

post.description:
Query the Wolfram Alpha API to solve problems or answer questions. This endpoint provides access to Wolfram Alpha's computational knowledge engine.
## Features - Access to Wolfram Alpha's knowledge base - Support for mathematical calculations - Scientific data and analysis - Option for simple API (returns image URL) or text API
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/wolframalpha/query \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "query": "integrate x^2 sin(x)",
    "simple": false
  }'
```

query.description: The question or problem to solve with Wolfram Alpha

app_id.description: The Wolfram Alpha API key (optional, uses environment variable if not provided)

simple.description: Whether to use the simple API (returns an image URL) instead of the text API

result.description: The result of the query (if result_type is text)

result_url.description: URL to the result image (if result_type is image)

get.description:
Get the JSON schema for the Wolfram Alpha tool. This is useful for integrating the Wolfram Alpha tool with other AI models and tools.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X GET https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/wolframalpha/schema \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key"
```

description.example: Query the Wolfram Alpha knowledge engine to solve problems or answer questions

post.description:
Execute the query_wolframalpha tool directly without going through the provider's tool calling mechanism. This endpoint is useful for direct API access or for providers that don't support tool calling.
## CURL Example ```bash curl -X POST https://api.assisted.space/v2/tools/execute/query_wolframalpha \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "X-API-Key: your_api_key" \
  -d '{
    "query": "distance from Earth to Mars",
    "simple": false
  }'
```

query.description: The question or problem to solve with Wolfram Alpha

simple.description: Whether to use the simple API (returns an image URL) instead of the text API

created.description: Unix timestamp of when the image was created

url.description: The URL for the generated image, available for 1 hour

b64_json.description: The base64-encoded JSON of the generated image (if requested)

revised_prompt.description: The prompt that was used to generate the image, potentially modified for safety

model.description: The model used to generate the images

error.description: Error message describing what went wrong

description.description: Description of what the tool does
description.example: Get the current weather in a given location

parameters.description: JSON Schema object describing the parameters for the tool

result.example:
Text Analysis Results:

  Sentiment: positive
  Entities: New York City
  No offensive content detected.

text.example: I really enjoyed visiting New York City last summer. The people were friendly and the food was amazing.

language.description: The language code used for analysis

success.description: Whether the format conversion was successful

result.example:
name: John Doe
age: 30
address:
  street: 123 Main St
  city: Anytown
  zip: '12345'
hobbies:
- reading
- running
- coding

original_data.description: The original data that was converted

model.description: The Gemini model to use

prompt.example: Write a short poem about artificial intelligence

max_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

image_path.description: Path to an image file (server-side, admin only)

model.description: The OpenAI model to use (e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4o-2024-11-20)

prompt.description: Instruction for the AI model about how to process the document
prompt.example: Please analyze this document and provide a detailed summary

file.description: File(s) to process (PDF, TXT, DOCX, etc.)

tools.description: Tools to make available to the model

web_search.description: Whether to enable web search capability

file_search.description: Whether to enable file search for document Q&A

computer_use.description: Whether to enable computer use tools

debug_mode.description: Whether to enable debug mode for detailed processing info

tool_choice.description: How the model should choose to use tools

response_id.description: The ID of the response, used to retrieve the result

status.description: The status of the request (completed, processing, error)

content.description: The content of the response (if completed immediately)

model.description: The model used to process the document

provider.description: The provider used to process the document
